thread.title: Former President George H.W. Bush Hospitalized
thread.title_full: Former President George H.W. Bush Hospitalized

author: Jack Davis
title: Former President George H.W. Bush Hospitalized
text:
Former President George H.W. Bush Hospitalized "Being monitored ..." Share on Facebook 137 Tweet Email Email Print Advertisement - story continues below 
Former President George H.W. Bush, 92, is currently in a Houston hospital after suffering “shortness of breath,” his office said Wednesday. 
Bush is “fine and he’s doing really well” at Houston Methodist Hospital, the Houston Chronicle quoted Bush’s chief of staff Jean Becker as saying. 
Station KHOU quoted Becker as saying Bush had been given antibiotics and was responding well to the drugs. Advertisement - story continues below Jimmy Carter: Only Former President Committed To Attending Trump’s Inauguration 
Spokesmen indicated they expected Bush to be released within the next few days. . @GeorgeHWBush was taken to @MethodistHosp Sat. for shortness of breath, has responded very well to treatments. Hope to have him out soon. 
— Jim McGrath (@jgm41) January 18, 2017 
CNN quoted spokesman Jim McGrath as saying Bush had been hospitalized since Saturday. Advertisement - story continues below 
A statement released later Wednesday said Bush was “being monitored as a precaution and is resting comfortably.” 
Many officials sent their wishes for a speedy recovery for the patriarch of the Bush political clan. Keeping @GeorgeHWBush in our thoughts and prayers this morning. God bless and get well soon! 
— Mike Pence (@mike_pence) January 18, 2017 All our best wishes to President @GeorgeHWBush and his family. https://t.co/pNY1D79rL8 
— Paul Ryan (@SpeakerRyan) January 18, 2017 Advertisement - story continues below
